page.title: 03Local Government
page.content: Thorncombe is represented at Parish Council level by nine elected members, all resident in the parish. They are aided by a clerk who may be paid. The electorate is 532 in number. Parish councilors act mainly in a watchdog capacity. They see and make recommendations on all local planning applications and may provide from a limited rate, amenities which are not the responsibility of other authorities, which are the West Dorset District Council and Dorset County Council. thorncombe shares with other parishes one representative on each of these bodies. Thorncombe was named as a priority village in the first draft plan for West Dorset Rural Development in July 1985 which will mean the building of more homes in increase the population and be able to retain our school general store & PO.
